result.execSummary:
The defendant John T. Oberjat was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall write a letter of apology to A.O. due within 30 days of sentencing and preapproved by probation.  Defendant shall undergo counseling as deemed appropriate by probation.  Defendant shall obtain his HSED/GED or adult diploma at agent's discretion.    Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 
If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA and follow though with any recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant John T. Oberjat in court with attorney Alec Phillip Nocco.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea agreement put into record.  Victim notification has been complied.  State moves to drop enhancer.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest to the amended charge of DC.  Plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; factual basis exists.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Court orders withheld sentence probation for one year; court costs; DNA surcharge; AODA; letter of apology to A.O.  due within 30 days and preapproved by probation; counseling as deemed appropriate; obtain HSED/GED or adult diploma at agent's discretion.  - rt
